item.description:
Members of the Friends of Myles Standish Hiking and Birding Group are invited to join the AMC at their summer picnic 9-4 at Charge Pond Pavillion.
Activities include nature walks, hikes, biking and an afternoon family walk around the East head Resevoir.

Activities will be followed by LOTS of good food beginning around 1:00pm with our partial-pot-luck lunch and our Fourth Annual Cherry Pit Spitting Contest .

The Chapter will provide hamburgers, veggie burgers, soft drinks, watermelon (and cherries). Participants should supply the side dishes and salad. (If your last name begins with A-I, please bring side dishes; if J-R, please bring salad; if S-Z, please bring dessert.) Please be sure to bring a cooler with sufficient ice for items that must be kept cold. Alcohol is not allowed in the State Forest.

Charge Pond is an 18 acre pond open to swimming, fishing and paddling, but has no life guard. Overnight campsites in Area A are available. Reservations for the best sites should be made through Reserve America. And donâ€™t forget the sun, fun, and camaraderie of getting together with your friendly, like-minded fellow SEMers and Friends of MSSF! All this for just $5 pp for individual adults, or $10 per family.

Pre registration is required. To register, please contact:

Joanne Jarzobski 508-212-4427
Claire Goode 508-759-7362
Don't forget your camp chairs.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Appalachian Mountain Club Summer Picnic
